title: ISic001291. Epitaph for Galates
body:
1Θ(εοῖς) Κ(αταχθονίοις)
2Γαλάτης
3ἔζησε ἔτη
4· π´ · ἐποίη-
5σεν υἱὸς
6Πριμιγένης

1ΘΚ
2ΓΑΛΑΤΗΣ
3ΕΖΗΣΕΕΤΗ
4·Π·ΕΠΟΙΗ
5ΣΕΝΥΙΟΣ
6ΠΡΙΜΙΓΕΝΗΣ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text based on photographs;
  • line.6: Torremuzza, Ferrara: Πριμιγένη; Franz, Korhonen: Πριμιγένης; Kaibel: Πριμιγένις

English translation

Marta Fogagnolo

To the underworld spirits. Galates lived for 80 years. His son, Primigenes made it.

Italian translation

Marta Fogagnolo

Agli Dei inferi. Galates visse 80 anni. Lo ha realizzato il figlio, Primigenes.

commentary

The epitaph presents the traditional formula with the invocation to the underworld spirits, the name of the deceased, his age and the name of the dedicant (Korhonen 2004: 86-87). Γαλάτης recurs in the Latin form in inscriptions of South Italy (LGPN 3a: 96), whereas Πριμιγένης seems to be a contamination between the Greek form Πρωτογένης and the Latin form Primigenius (Solin 2005: 170). This inscription is classified in LGPN 3a: 376 under the name Πριμογένις. Πριμογένης recurs in another inscription from Catania, IG 14.546 = ISic001365, and in an inscription from Syracuse, IGCVO 1339 = MARPO inv.15591 (in both the form is Πριγομένης, with an inversion of μ and γ).

bibliography

  • 14.0467 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 90 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • 3.5701 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001252
  • Castelli 1769 151 no. 29 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002084
  • Castelli 1784 158 no. 32 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002083
  • Ferrara 1829 354 no. 2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002005
  • 86-87 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • Solin 2005 170 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001423
